author: Homeland Security Today
title: Coast Guard Rescues 2 Hikers and Dog in Deschutes National Forest, Oregon
text:
The Coast Guard rescued two hikers and a dog after one of the hikers sustained a knee injury Sunday in Deschutes National Forest, Oregon.
Watchstanders at the 13th Coast Guard District Command Center in Seattle received a report at 4:20 p.m. by the Oregon Department of Emergency Management of a 14-year-old female hiker who sustained a severe knee injury and was unable to hike back to the trailhead.
Watchstanders directed the launch of an MH-60 Jayhawk helicopter aircrew from Coast Guard Air Station Astoria to assist.
The aircrew arrived on scene at approximately 6:30 p.m.
Due to the steep terrain and tree height exceeding the helicopter’s hoist cable length, the two rescue swimmers were lowered approximately a quarter of a mile from the hiker’s location.
The rescue swimmers located the hiker and her father and used a confined space stretcher to carry and drag the patient over fallen trees rocks and snow back to the hoisting area.
The aircrew hoisted the injured hiker along with her father and dog into the helicopter and transported them to Redmond Municipal Airport to awaiting emergency medical services in stable condition.
“This was an incredibly challenging but rewarding rescue,” said Lt. Cmdr. Jason Weeks. “The environment in this region posed significant challenges but, because of our constant training for dynamic conditions such as these, we were able to work together as an effective team and complete our mission successfully. This aircrew consisted of three dads, so it was very heartwarming to, on Father’s Day, to play a role in the safe return of a father and his daughter back to safety.”
Before venturing outdoors, the Coast Guard wants to remind people to follow these recommended safety guidelines:
- Carry a form of communication in the event you need assistance.
- File a travel plan and leave it with somebody you trust. It should include when you are leaving, where you will be, how long you will be gone and when you plan to return.
- Carry the appropriate gear, including a first aid kit, food, water and extra clothing in the event you need to shelter in place. In an emergency, rescuers may take several hours to reach your location.

author: Manu López
title: La Liga F revela la lista de nominadas al Player of the Month del mes de marzo
text:
La Liga F fue elegida por EA SPORTS para convertirse en la primera liga femenina en estrenar la elección de la jugadora del mes: ‘Player of the month’. La marca de videojuegos arrancó durante el mes de septiembre esta pionera campaña en el fútbol femenino mundial. La galardonada a mejor jugadora del mes del primer mes de competición fue Rasheedat Ajibade. A la atacante nigeriana se le unieron las azulgranas Alexia Putellas, como ganadora del mes de octubre, Patri Guijarro, que recibió el premio en el mes de noviembre, Edna Imade, que lo ganó en diciembre, Linda Caicedo, que se lo llevó en enero y Gift Monday, que logró imponerse en el mes de febrero. Las votaciones de marzo se vuelven a abrir hasta el domingo.
De esta manera, Liga F se unió a otras cinco competiciones masculinas que ya ofrecen este galardón de la mano de EA SPORTS: LALIGA EA SPORTS, Premier League, Serie A, Bundesliga y Ligue 1. Además, la marca de videojuegos ya puso en marcha durante la Jornada 2 de Liga F la campaña ‘FC Ratings Reveal’, donde las futbolistas de Liga F portaron camisetas para revelar sus ratings con los dorsales personalizados de su puntuación alcanzada en el videojuego. Dos acciones para seguir promoviendo el crecimiento del fútbol femenino.
Tras las veintidós primeras jornadas de competición, siete son las futbolistas que parten como nominadas a mejor jugadora del mes de marzo, a las que todos los aficionados podrán votar a partir del miércoles 19 de marzo, a través de este enlace. Las siete futbolistas nominadas son:
FC Barcelona: Ewa Pajor
Real Madrid CF: Olga Carmona
Atlético de Madrid: Gio Queiroz
Sevilla FC: Gemma Gili
Madrid CFF: Allegra Poljak
Levante UD: Ivonne Chacón
Valencia CF: Marina Martí
El anuncio de la ganadora del trofeo a “mejor jugadora del mes de marzo” se desvelará el lunes 31 de marzo a través de los canales oficiales de EA SPORTS y Liga F, y recibirá el galardón en los prolegómenos de un partido de Liga F ante su afición.

author: newsdirectory3
title: Storm Alert: Andalusia Braces for Severe Weather as Red and Orange Warnings Issued
text:
The Spanish Meteorological Agency has issued an important weather update, issuing red and orange warning codes in the Autonomous Community of Andalucia, especially for the province of Huelva and its coastal area. The warning is valid for Friday and refers to heavy rain, significant water falls and intensifying winds in the Autonomous Community of Andalusia.
The Romanian Ministry of Foreign Affairs (MAE) is advising Romanian citizens in Andalucia, whether they are traveling or planning to travel to the region, to be aware of these severe weather conditions.
Recommendations for Romanians in the region The Consulate General of Romania in Seville recommends avoiding non -urgent travel and offers Romanian citizens a telephone number for consular assistance: +34 954 233 243, +34 954 230 947, +34 954 624 053 and +34 954 624 070. The calls are redirected to the Contact and Support Center for Foreign Citizens of Romania (CCSCRS), where operators are available 24/7.
In cases of emergency, Romanian citizens can contact the Consulate General on the emergency number +34 648 212 169. The MAE also recommends consulting the official websites for updated weather information and consular assistance , including www.meteoalarm.org a www.mae.ro .

author: Judah Duke
title: Former Briggs Freeman VP Moves to Compass
text: Faisal Halum, one of Texas’ top-producing brokers, has moved to Compass from Briggs Freeman Sotheby’s International Real Estate. Faisal Halum Group, his four-agent team, ranked second in Texas by volume with $188 million last year, according to [RealTrends Verified](https://www.realtrends.com/ranking/best-real-estate-agents-texas/teams-small-volume/). Halum’s move comes as fundamental changes to the brokerage business spread across the industry, spurred by [NAR’s landmark commissions settlement](/national/2024/03/15/heres-what-nars-landmark-commissions-settlement-means/) and continued high mortgage rates. Beyond agent compensation, subtler changes are also happening in the Dallas market. Halum’s background in architecture, along with a degree in building construction, has helped him specialize in selling architecturally significant homes, estates and high-rise condominiums to high-profile athletes, celebrities and socialites. In particular, Faisal says Dallas condos are undervalued. “Dallas has really never been known as a condo market — especially to locals it hasn’t — but that’s changing,” he says. While Dallas buyers don’t normally spring for condos as often as single-family homes compared to other major cities, condos were sold for less per square foot on average than single-family homes in July, $240 and $248, respectively, compared to $261 per square foot on average for condos and $187 for single-family homes in Texas as a whole, according to [flyhomes](https://flyhomes.com/en/housing-market-analysis/dallas--tx). Halum has been active in the high-end condo market, but he has a solid footing in single-family home and estate sales; he recently facilitated the sale of a 9,000 square foot ultra-modern estate near Preston Hollow in May, last listed for $7.85 million, and another home last listed at $750,000 near Munger Place, according to Zillow. His sales volume this year, so far, is well over $100 million, he estimates. Read more [](/texas/2024/09/03/movers-carter-bechtol-to-triten-jon-farris-to-stream-realty/) Commercial Texas Movers: Carter Bechtol to Triten; Jon Farris to Stream Realty [](/miami/2024/08/29/ellimans-thor-brown-jumps-to-compass-in-palm-beach/) Residential South Florida Elliman’s Thor Brown jumps to Compass in Palm Beach [](/new-york/2024/08/16/maggie-marshall-trades-elliman-for-compass/) Residential New York Maggie Marshall trades Elliman for Compass

author: Столица С
title: Юрий Подоляка: «Нас можно победить только изнутри. Разрушив наше единство»
text:
Юрий Подоляка: «Нас можно победить только изнутри. Разрушив наше единство»
» День России… Я понимаю всю сложность и двоякость отношения к этому празднику для многих граждан (и для руководства страны в том числе), — написал журналист Юрий Подоляка. — С одной стороны, у почти каждой современной страны (по западному клише) есть праздник, объединяющий подавляющее большинство граждан, олицетворяющую саму суть страны.
Условный день независимости.
У России сложная историческая судьба, а еще ментальность. А потому и праздник «День России» (независимости) полученный ею в наследство от Бориса Ельцина для многих россиян (согласно опросов) никогда с таковой не ассоциировался.
В отличие от, например, «Дня народного единства» (4 ноября), который несет на порядок более мощную в этом плане для нас нагрузку.
С другой стороны, «День России» — официально праздник. День, в который формально началось формирование нынешней формы государственности в стране.
И здесь крайне важно его смысловое наполнение. Лично я его воспринимаю как еще один день, когда мы должны думать о нашем ЕДИНСТВЕ. Одном из самых наших больших богатств и ценности. Которую противник всеми силами пытается уничтожить.
Потому что наша тысячелетняя история страны показала, что нас можно победить только изнутри. Разрушив наше единство».
